author: John Cross
title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte confident his league leaders will not wilt facing Liverpool at daunting Anfield
text:
Sport Chelsea boss Antonio Conte confident his league leaders will not wilt facing Liverpool at daunting Anfield The Italian knows avenging their defeat in September's fixture would be a big statement of intent for the Blues Share Chelsea's will to win under Conte gets one of its biggest tests yet on Tuesday night (Photo: Getty / Wenn) Share Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Antonio Conte will be making his first ever trip to Anfield with a determination to write his own chapter of history in one of football’s great cathedrals. 
In recent years, Chelsea have had some memorable battles with Liverpool, featuring incidents such as the Ghost Goal, Steven Gerrard’s costly slip and Luis Suarez biting Branislav Ivanovic. 
Conte is aware of the fixture's rich history and rivalry and says before Tuesday night's latest installment that the Blues' current generation are “strong” enough to lay down another statement of intent as they march towards the title. 
The former Italy boss, who had a glittering career with Juventus as a player and then their manager, said: “I didn't play any football at Liverpool. As a manager, this is the first time to go and play at Anfield. 
“For sure, it'll be a good experience, a good place to visit and, above all, to play our football. As manager, I'm excited for this experience. May 2005: Chelsea STILL say Luis Garcia's Champions League semi-final goal didn't go in (Photo: Getty) April 2013: Luis Suarez sinks his gnashers into Blues defender Ivanovic (Photo: Sky Sports) May 2014: Gerrard stumbling was the beginning of the end for Liverpool's title dream (Photo: Getty) 
“I know in the past there were a lot of games very strong, very strong, between Liverpool and Chelsea. Between some players. I know this. But now it's important, the present. It's important to see the present and have strong players to face this type of game. 
"I'm sure I have this type of player.” 
It is also a chance for Chelsea to prove how far they have come since the reverse fixture. 
They suffered their first defeat under the Italian against Liverpool at Stamford Bridge in September, and then lost badly at Arsenal the following weekend. Jordan Henderson scored a cracker as Liverpool won at Chelsea in September... (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) ...and when Conte's men lost at Arsenal a week later, changes had to be made (Photo: Getty) 
Conte angrily accused his men of not being a team, and it was from there that they went on their remarkable 13-game winning run that has helped push them eight points clear at the top. 
“In Chelsea, we're working a lot on every aspect,” he said. “In six months, our work is incredible — above all, if you compare our position now to last season — but we still have room to improve. 
“After the second defeat [where Arsenal were 3-0 up at halftime], something changed in our minds, in our way to think, a new type of football and a new idea. To find the right solution.
